text: in my go-to Copenhagen 2023 talk you'll
learn about the nine secrets that
productive teams use in order to improve
the speed with which they deliver
software and their confidence in
production and how it leads to scoring
better on the Dora
metrics in particular you're going to
learn about using hermetic
infrastructure in order to make things
reproducible to speed up your continuous
integration and delivery architecture in
order to make sure that application code
reaches production as quickly as
possible you'll learn about
observability practices to improve your
team's confidence to ship in production
without breaking things and you'll learn
about feature Flags in order to reduce
the amount of blast radius and ensure
that changes if they do fail don't fail
catastrophically additionally you'll be
learning about how to foster a culture
of code ownership and of collaboration
within your teams in order to make sure
that everyone on your team can
participate in the running of production
in the delivery of software you'll also
learn about blameless culture and
blameless retrospectives and how to make
sure that your teams are learning as
much as possible from each
incident and you'll learn about service
level objectives for understanding how
your users are actually experiencing
your service and what you can do to make
their experience better and finally
you're going to learn about chaos
engineering and how you can really test
some of those assumptions once you have
a mature platform practice and finally
you'll learn about how to employ
platform engineering as a discipline in
order to bring the benefits of each of
these eight previous techniques to all
of your teams rather than each team
having to reinvent the eight principles
on their own I look forward to your
reaction to the lessons and how you'll
deploy them to your own team
